greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) = number of k-dimensional isotropic subspaces of Spin(2n+1,C), n >= 1, 1 <= k <= n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n, k) = A141419(2*n-k, k). - _Peter Munn_, Aug 21 2019
maple: T:=(n,k) -> k*(k+1)/2+2*k*(n-k); r:=n->[seq(T(n,k),k=1..n)]; for r from 1 to 12 do lprint(r(n)); od: # _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 21 2019
mathematica: nmax = 12; t[n_, k_] := If[k < 1 || k > n, 0, k*(k+1)/2 + 2*k*(n-k)]; Flatten[ Table[t[n , k], {n, 1, nmax}, {k, 1, n}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 19 2011, after PARI *)
program: (Sage) [[k*(k+1 + 4*(n-k))/2 for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 05 2019
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 28 2002
ext: Offset changed to 1. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 21 2019
